intro: Vilfa trichodes, commonly known as the hairy vilfa, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant is distinguished by its hairy stems and leaves, which help it retain moisture in arid environments. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the spring, attracting various pollinators. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, Vilfa trichodes is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
